alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 10:14AM CDT until April 09 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to increased melting. Flows in rivers increased quickly and are forecasted to remain in minor flooding. Dry and warm conditions expected over the next few days, resulting in continual melting snow. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.3 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall Friday evening. It will rise to 15.3 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 05/10/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM CDT.
